meanings.definition: In a bad-tempered or irritable mood.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he became even grouchier.
meanings.sent2: She always seems grouchier in the mornings.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked grouchier than usual when it saw the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: His face grew grouchier with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds made the whole world feel grouchier.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to complain or grumble.
meanings.sent1: The old man became grouchier as the service took longer.
meanings.sent2: Her grouchier attitude was evident during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The grouchier customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: His grouchier nature made him hard to please.
meanings.sent5: The grouchier tone in her voice was unmistakable.
